St. Clair Shores is the easternmost end of Detroits "Mile Roads" Its main streets are Harper, Little Mack, Greater Mack and Jefferson Avenue.  These run north to south. Major east west roads are 8 Mile (Vernier Rd), 9 Mile, 10 Mile, 11 Mile, 12 Mile, 13 Mile and 14 Mile.

A must see is the "Nautical Mile" on Jefferson between 9 and 10 Mile Roads. It as the largest concentration of public marinas and boat dealerships in the Midwest.  Numerous other businesses catering to the boating industry are located there as well as restaurants with the nautical theme.
Visit the "Nautical Mile" in the spring/summer.  It virtually comes to a standstill in the fall and especially in the winter.  Ice Fishing is a popular activity in the winter.
Gifts Afloat is a store on 10 Mile and Jefferson with an extensive selcetion of gifts catering to the boating crowd.

Jack's Waterfront Restaurant is located in the heart of the nautical mile.  It has a tiki bar and faces Lake St. Clair.  It was made famous by it being featured on Kitchen Nightmares.  Other places are Waves, Fishbones, The Beach Grill

Jack's Waterfront Restaurant is a drinkers paradise  Other places known for their libations include Waves, The Beach Grill, Shores Inn, Tom's Oyster Bar, The Plaid Rabbit, and Fishbones.
St. Clair Shores is unique in that, for a city its size, it has no hotels or motels. Many exits off of I-94 have your typical chain hotels such as Red Roof or Baymont Inns.

Airport Shuttle Services are available from St Clair Shores, Harper Woods, Eastpointe, Grosse Pointes, and Roseville. The rate from these cities is $59.00 to Detroit Metropolitan Airport. Reservations 9a-9p. You can contact Shores Airport Transportation (586) 744-3168.

The 4 land based casino's in Detroit are all within a 30 minute drive from St. Clair Shores.  The MGM Grand Detroit Casino, Motor City Casino, and Greektown Casino, and Ceasars Windsor are well worth the visit.  Ford Field, Comerica Park and Joe Louis Arenas are all withing a 30 minute drive from St. Clair Shores.
